result.execSummary:
The defendant William James Butzine was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Probation review hearing on August 13, 2018 at 01:00 pm.
Court Memo regarding Request for Review Hearing from Agent Emily Kerr dated July 17, 2018

Defendant called in regards to the probation review hearing on Wednesday - January 17th, just received the paperwork in the mail.  Informed the defendant of the happenings from court and instructed him to contact his agent.  Also reminded the defendant that he needed to get this paid.
43
Petition and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Order Extending Probation for Unpaid Court Obligations - one year (01/19/2019)

11:02 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Agent Emily Kerr present in court via telephone.  Statement by the Court.  Court finds good cause that the defendant has not made a good faith effort, and has not appeared and will extend probation for a period of 1 year.  Court informs Agent Kerr to contact the Clerk of Courts within the 6 months if no monies have been paid and the Court will schedule up a hearing instead of waiting until the end of the year.  Court has no objection if paid in full that the defendant can discharge from probation immediately.

Court adjourned at 11:04 a.m.
Letter from Agent Emily Kerr dated January 3, 2018 re: extension of probation
Probation review hearing on January 17, 2018 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Petition and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Order Extending Probation for Unpaid Court Obligations - 6 months (01/19/2018)

1:22 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Agent Emily Kerr present in court via telephone.  Court questions defendant regarding monies.  Defendant confirms has paid no monies.  Court finds the defendant has not made a good faith effort and extends probation for a period of one year.  Court informs defendant that if probation is extended again, the Court will fashion conditions to include jail time.  Court goes over right to counsel.

Court adjourned at 1:25 p.m.
Probation review hearing on June 19, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
2:09 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Joey Roeth.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 2 with probation.  State concurs.  Atty Reoth concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 2 as charged.  Court orders count 1 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Roeth.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 1 year.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 2:16 p.m.
